Tucson smiles and puts a hand on Rodimus's shoulder.

"A favor I would not =
mind doing for you again, Rodimus. You're worth more to me than any preciou=
s metal or power source.  And, Torca's right, I - could use a rest, but, pe=
rhaps I will get that when I undergo the repairs to my optic sensors.   Sta=
nton, I need to ask you a favor.  One that I know is extremely difficult to=
 accomplish, and one that I'd never ask of you unless it was a dire need.  =
I would like you to attempt the delicate process of bringing my optic senso=
rs back online.  If it doesn't work, I understand.  But I saw how important=
 it was for me to be able to see in order to get an idea of the situation a=
t hand and how to remedy it.  A blind eye can only go so far.  And if at al=
l possible, could the same be done for Perceptor? He too, deserves a second=
 chance of seeing things in a whole new light."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.=

the tables which desperately need turning."
